items.name: Component_EventEmitter
items.content: # =================================================================== # # Script: Component_EventEmitter # # $$COPYRIGHT$$ # # =================================================================== class Component_EventEmitter extends gs.Component #@objectCodecBlackList = ["handlers"] ###* * Called if this object instance is restored from a data-bundle. It can be used * re-assign event-handler, anonymous functions, etc. * * @method onDataBundleRestore. * @param Object data - The data-bundle * @param gs.ObjectCodecContext context - The codec-context. ### onDataBundleRestore: (data, context) -> for k of @handlers list = @handlers[k] for i in [0...list.length] handlers = list[i] j = 0 while j < handlers.length handler = handlers[j] if !handler.handler or !handler.handler.$vnm_cb handlers.splice(j, 1) else j++ #@handlers = {} return null ###* * A component which allow a game object to fire events and manage a list * of observers. * * @module gs * @class Component_EventEmitter * @extends gs.Component * @memberof gs ### constructor: -> super ###* * List of registered observers. * * @property handlers * @type Object * @private ### @handlers = {} ###* * @property defaultData * @type Object * @private ### @defaultData = {} ###* * @property chainInfo * @type Object * @private ### @chainInfo = {} ###* * @property needsSort * @type boolean * @private ### @needsSort = {} ###* * @property markedForRemove * @type Object[] * @private ### @markedForRemove = [] ###* * @property isEmitting * @type number * @private ### @isEmitting = 0 ###* * Clears the event emitter by removing all handlers/listeners. * * @method clear ### clear: -> @needsSort = {} @handlers = {} @defaultData = {} ###* * Adds a new observer/listener for a specified event. * * @method on * @param {string} eventName - The event name. * @param {function} handler - The handler-function called when the event is fired. * @param {Object} [data={}] - An optional info-object passed to the handler-function. * @param {Object} [owner=null] - An optional owner-object associated with the observer/listener. * @param {number} priority - An optional priority level. An observer/listener with a higher level will receive the event before observers/listeners with a lower level. * @return {gs.EventObserver} - The added observer-object. ### on: (eventName, handler, data, owner, priority) -> priority = priority || 0 @needsSort[eventName] = true if not @handlers[eventName]? @handlers[eventName] = [] if not @handlers[eventName][priority] @handlers[eventName][priority] = [] handlerObject = { handler: handler, once: no, data: data, owner: owner, eventName: eventName, priority: priority } @handlers[eventName][priority].push(handlerObject) return handlerObject ###* * Adds a new observer/listener for a specified event and removes it * after the even has been emitted once. * * @method once * @param {string} eventName - The event name. * @param {function} handler - The handler-function called when the event is fired. * @param {Object} [data={}] - An optional info-object passed to the handler-function. * @param {Object} [owner=null] - An optional owner-object associated with the observer/listener. * @param {number} priority - An optional priority level. An observer/listener with a higher level will receive the event before observers/listeners with a lower level. * @return {gs.EventObserver} - The added observer-object. ### once: (eventName, handler, data, owner, priority) -> handlerObject = @on(eventName, handler, data, owner, priority) handlerObject.once = yes return handlerObject ###* * Removes an observer/listener from a specified event. If handler parameter * is null, all observers for the specified event are removed. * * @method off * @param {string} eventName - The event name. * @param {gs.EventObserver} [handler=null] - The observer-object to remove. * If null, all observers for the specified event are removed. ### off: (eventName, handler) -> if @isEmitting > 0 and handler @markedForRemove.push(handler) else if handler? @handlers[eventName]?[handler.priority]?.remove(handler) else @handlers[eventName] = [] ###* * Removes all observers/listeners from an event which are belonging to the specified * owner. * * @method offByOwner * @param {string} eventName - The event name. * @param {Object} owner - The owner. * @return {number} Count of removed observers/listeners. ### offByOwner: (eventName, owner) -> if @handlers[eventName] if @isEmitting > 0 for handlerList in @handlers[eventName] handlers = handlerList?.where (x) -> x.owner == owner for handler in handlers @markedForRemove.push(handler) else for handlerList in @handlers[eventName] handlerList.removeAll((x) -> x.owner == owner) ###* * Emits the specified event. All observers/listeners registered for the * specified event are informed. * * @method emit * @param {string} eventName - The name of the event to fire. * @param {Object} [sender=null] - The sender of the event. * @param {Object} [data={}] - An optional object passed to each handler-function. ### emit: (eventName, sender, data) -> handlerLists = @handlers[eventName] data = data ? @defaultData if handlerLists and @needsSort[eventName] @needsSort[eventName] = no for handlerList in handlerLists handlerList.sort (a, b) -> if a.owner and b.owner if a.owner.rIndex > b.owner.rIndex return -1 else if a.owner.rIndex < b.owner.rIndex return 1 else return 0 else return -1 if handlerLists? for handlerList in handlerLists by -1 if !handlerList then continue i = 0 count = handlerList.length @isEmitting++ while i < count handler = handlerList[i] data.handler = handler data.sender = sender data.data = handler.data if !handler.owner or !handler.owner.visible? or handler.owner.visible handler.handler(data) if handler.once @markedForRemove.push(handler) if data.breakChain data.breakChain = no break i++ @isEmitting-- if !@isEmitting and @markedForRemove.length > 0 for handler in @markedForRemove @handlers[handler.eventName][handler.priority].remove(handler) @markedForRemove = [] return null ###* * Checks if an event-handler with a specified owner exists for the * given event. * * @method checkForOwner * @param {string} eventName - The event name. * @param {function} owner - The owner to search for. * @return {boolean} If true, an event-handler with the specified owner * exists for the given event. Otherwise false. ### checkForOwner: (eventName, owner) -> result = no for handler in @handlers[eventName] if handler.owner == owner result = yes break return result ###* * Checks if an event-handler with a specified handler-function exists for the * given event. * * @method checkForHandlerFunction * @param {string} eventName - The event name. * @param {function} handlerFunction - The handler-function to search for. * @return {boolean} If true, an observer witht he specified handler-function * exists for the given event. Otherwise false. ### checkForHandlerFunction: (eventName, handlerFunction) -> result = no if handlerFunction? for handler in @handlers[eventName] if handler.handler == handlerFunction result = yes break return result ###* * Not implemented yet. * @method update ### # FIXME: Why should event-emitter influence the active-property? update: -> @object.active = @object.active and (!@object.parent or @object.parent.active) gs.Component_EventEmitter = Component_EventEmitter gs.EventEmitter = Component_EventEmitter gs.GlobalEventManager = new Component_EventEmitter()
